messages: e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (19:34): ah what the heck
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (19:34): good morning, Whatwg!
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:36): morning e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024!
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:36): wonders if everyone has Easter Monday off
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (19:37): but some peeps do.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:38): we do, though I've done some work anyway
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (19:40): You're a Unicorn!
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:42): orly?
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (19:56): yes, edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e, rly.
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (20:17): Is there no -moz-linear-gradient equiv in Opera, still?
8c8837db54a2907cacd8633547977e33 (20:23): wasn't there a CSS Opera logo recently that I thought used one?  or did someone just make one for the heck of it?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (20:24): http://desandro.com/articles/opera-logo-css/
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (20:24): It doesn't work in Opera
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (20:24): http://people.opera.com/howcome/2010/tests/operalogo.html
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (20:25): Absolut semantic markup
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (20:27): we don't do gradients yet
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (20:27): ah, got it.
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (20:28): iz cool, just making sure I was supporting Opera's syntax if it was there.
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (20:29): How would you make that accessible the best way?
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (20:31): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9, was that question for me?  If so, I don't quite understand the question.
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (20:31): <div><div></div><div></div><div></div><div></div><div></div><div></div><div></div><div></div></div> doesn't explain very much what's going on
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (20:34): Yah where's the semantic O in the middle of it?
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (20:38): They have classnames, a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 :)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:40): notes we can render the Opera logo using SVG
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (20:45): You'll have gradient soon enough, fo sho.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:47): Moz just happened to be the first to implement the new gradient syntax.  Others will get on the ball soon enough.
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (20:53): entrance?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:54): Eh, forgot the /.  Wanted to reload my prefs.
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (20:58): Oh, you weren't just being dramatic :)
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (21:12): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: So should I wait on writing counterproposals?  I was going to block out some time this week for them.
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (21:12): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: it's never a problem to start early, or to submit proposals without a formal call
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (21:13): Sure, but if something might get rejected before having counterproposals asked for, it's a waste of time for me to do anything.  Is that a possibility?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (21:13): Basically I am trying to minimize the amount of time I waste on countering ridiculousness.

65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (21:14): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: I don't know. I have suggested to the other co-chairs that if a proposal has no support besides the author, and significant opposition, we should consider just doing a call for consensus to reject it.
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (21:14): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: (a) Not sure what they will think. (b) Not sure if Laura's comments can be counted as "support".
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (21:14): we will probably decide on some course of action for at least some of the proposals by early this week
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (21:15): K.  I'll stay in the loop, but not plan on anything yet.
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (21:20): Hixie said he thought one counter-proposal might be sufficient to counter all the semantic element/attribute proposals
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (21:20): perhaps not literally identical text, but at least a template
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (21:20): you could maybe consider using a wiki, since others (e.g. John Foliot) have expressed interest in contributing
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (21:21): Yeah, I'll put it up on the wiki if I start on them.
fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98 (21:30): I had started my ISSUE-95 zero-edit CP a while ago; I'd be willing to generalize it into a broader one for the several related issues

fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98 (21:31): here's the existing text; I have several recent emails flagged in gmail as source material for updating the CP this week: http:/ fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98.jottit.com/issue-95_change_proposal
